diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The case is characteristic of Kleine-Levin syndrome, marked by recurrent self-limited episodes including euphoric mood, reduced sleep, hyperphagia, and hypersomnolence. The episodes include autonomic dysfunction episodes of flushing, salivation, tachycardia, and hypertension, indicative of diencephalic dysfunction. Neurological examination, imaging, and laboratory tests returned normal, supporting the diagnosis.
